alert.note: Alert for Bighorn Mountains Southeast; Northeast Johnson County (Wyoming) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 06 at 3:43PM MDT by NWS Riverton
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of north central Johnson County through 415 PM MDT... At 343 PM MDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over Fort Phil Kearny Historical Site, which is also 16 miles northwest of Buffalo, moving east at 30 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 30 mph and penny size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. This strong thunderstorm will be near... Lake De Smet around 355 PM MDT. This includes Interstate 90 between mile markers 42 and 53. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.75 IN MAX WIND GUST...30 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until 900 PM MDT for north central Wyoming.

area.areaDesc: Bighorn Mountains Southeast; Northeast Johnson County
